page.title: 14Twinning
page.content: The twinning of English towns and villages with others of similar size on the continent began after the war with the aim of increasing international understanding and friendship. Following the signing of a twinning charter by the county of Devon and the department of Calvados in Northern{France}, many towns and villages in{Devon}twinned with places in{Calvados . In 1976{Swimbridge}signed a twinning charter with{St.Honorine Du Fay,}a village of about a 1000 inhabitants situated approximately eight miles from Caen . Every year since then a group of young people has spent a week in houses in their twin village and in alternate years a party of adults spend a weekend in each others village.
